You wait expectantly for Ashley to show some reaction to your spell, but nothing seems to happen. If anything, her interest in you seems to have taken a back seat to her phone, as her text conversation seems to pick up intensity.

“Someone has a lot to say,” you remark, attempting to discreetly figure out what’s going on. “Who are you talking to?”

* * *

“It’s my friend Trina,” she says, trying to turn her focus back to you. “Sorry about that… she’s usually not this talkative.”

As if on cue, the phone beeps again. Ashley looks at the screen and her eyebrows raise in confusion. “Trina wants to know if the two of you have met.”

You try to picture someone named Trina, but you draw a blank. You just shrug and say, “The name’s not familiar.”

No sooner does Ashley send that response, than the phone chirps back at her. Looking at the message, Ashley laughs and says, “Trina wants me to send her a picture of you. Are you ok with that?”

You cautiously consent to let Ashley snap a picture of you with her phone’s camera, all the while concerned that this will be yet another opportunity for you to be mocked by teenage girls who find your adolescent body more awkward than adorable. In fact, you were just beginning to really regret your decision, looking down at your feet that seem to be too big for your body, when Ashley laughs in response to the latest text message. Fearful for what cruelty Trina has written, you brace yourself, only to hear Ashley say, “Trina is so goofy… She wrote, ‘Oh, he’s HOT!’”

That wasn’t what you were expecting to hear. An inner battle began to rage, where the voice of reason was telling you that at best, Trina was just being nice, but probably she was being sarcastic and would soon follow up with some less-kind comments. The fantasy side of your head responded with, “At last… A girl actually likes what she sees and has the hots for me!”

You notice Ashley’s demeanor has changed a little, and instead of laughing, she looks concerned as she types on her phone. “What’s the matter?” you ask.

“I think Trina has been drinking or something,” came the response. “She’s definitely not acting like herself. She wanted to know if I had any other pictures of you.”

“She wants you to take more pictures of me?” you ask, confused.

“And not just any kind of pictures,” Ashley said. “She wants to know if I can get some pictures of you with few clothes on…” She lets her voice drop off as she realizes this is not the best thing to be sharing with a boy she is babysitting.

That’s when you begin to suspect that maybe something went wrong with that spell. Trina is showing the same kind of growing compulsion about you that Trina should be showing at this point.

You try to think this through when Ashley’s phone rings. You listen in on Ashley’s side of the conversation:

Your mind races to catch up with the implications of what you have heard. So your spell bypassed Ashley and hit her best friend. This could have serious ramifications.

Morgan’s stomach churned. “Uh...what?”

“Still a little confused?” Ashley asked Morgan, who’d brought his knees up to meet his chest. He nodded.

“Maybe this will help,” she said, and chanted a few more words. Before Morgan’s eyes, she morphed into a different woman, her hair darkening to jet-black, her skin changing hue, her eyes becoming almond-shaped -- she was now Asian.

“Ah, I was hoping the potions would carry over,” she said as she looked down at herself. She looked back up at Morgan and explained, “This is how I really look -- well, not quite this perfect. I guess you don’t recognize me, although that’s not a surprise -- you haven’t seen me in years. Your mother would know me, though, if I looked like this. I’m Kim Peacock’s daughter.”

Morgan knew the name as a rival witch his mother was often complaining about. From what he’d gleaned, his mother was better at magic through the use of objects -- potions, trinkets, wands -- but Kim Peacock excelled at magic through the use of language and gestures. That kind of magic was better for unpredictable situations, of course, but his mother’s type was more permanent.

Ashley gestured as she removed the towel, and a colorful kimono formed around her body -- as she turned to hang the towel up, Morgan saw that it had, of course, a giant peacock on the back.

She smiled, nodded and thanked you before retreating into the powder room and closing the door to prepare for her bath. She never noticed that the latch on the bracelet had disappeared, rendering her unable to remove it.

info.brief_description: A beautiful 18 year old girl takes a job babysitting a 14 year old boy. Mischief ensues
info.description:
You are Morgan Bennett, the 14 year old son of a renowned witch. When your mother goes on long business trips, she still hires a babysitter to watch you. But knowing where your mother's spare wand and potion supply are, the babysitter is really more of a plaything. Now into puberty, your hormones are strongly pushing you towards attractive members of the opposite sex. So when your mother gives you one as a 'babysitter', how can you resist?

Have fun, but don't be destructive or extreme
